column4: Just installed ubuntu this morning and trying it/linux out   Nothing else has been done
q: First program install attempt - installing xmms.  have files..  ran "./configure"  but got error -> configure: error: no acceptable C compiler found in $PATH See `config.log' for more details.
that is not how you install software on ubuntu
this is a platform with 17k+ packages all ready and waiting
- thanks..i've tryed mandrake before..so trying what I ..kind of knew :P
use system - administration - synaptic package manager, using source is last resource :)
- I see RPM there...but didn't seam to do anything - I typed cmd as: rpm -i <package name> .
sudo apt-get install xmms
- k.. will give it a run.  ...
the synaptic tool is easy to use - have a look at it and repositories - and mark these words  -Backports Are Evil
translated as use them if you dare, but please don't complain if they break stuff
one last thing I will get the bot to tell you about repos have a look at that before you go any further, will help a lot
- sorry dude...I'm just a windozer so far... you saying that xmms is backporting?  I"m not following closely enough on that one...
- no prob... I understand the reading that's ahead.... same as when I started with Dos I had a lot of reading... thanks

no I did not, what I said was if you use backports please be aware that they are evil - stay away from them :) - now as a windows user - use System - administration - Synaptic Package Manager - BUT first read what the bot will send you on repos

- not a prob...it's the backports part i'm not sure of what you mean.  I hear backports I think either a) older software wanting older libraries? or B) another installing means outside normal checks a system normally wants - such as forceing windows to accept a program by manually placing files, settings, and bypassing the windows installer?
backports are 'future packages' will be in the next version - and sometimes they cause a looooot of pain
pm?
Ahhh... i'm on the same page now...I understands.   pm? = pardon me?
private message -
- I gotta run... someone's just shown up....   ahh.. private message.. understand... thanks man.. I would.. but I  gotta run....
